Name: Net Y
Description:
Net Y is an acronym for Nested Tetrahedrons Y.  There are three superimposed, interdependent instances of Y which are played simultaneously.  Two of the grids are imprinted on tetrahedral shapes, and one is imprinted on a simple triangle.  The winner of the majority of the three wins overall.

Net Y rule sheet:
  http://www.marksteeregames.com/Net_Y_rules.pdf

Net Y printable game board:
  http://www.marksteeregames.com/Net_Y_board.pdf

Name: Jonathan: il Gioco Dell' Avventura
Description:
A route-puzzle game with a basic rules and advanced one. In basic game wins the player  who catches up for first the Pyramid, finding the faster distance that joins the card of departure to the same Pyramid. 
In the advanced game the player wins who accumulates more adventure points during the crossing of the jungle in order to arrive to the Pyramid.

Name: Aristo
Description:
From the back of the game box: 
Contents: Original plastic playing board plus 64 two sided (yellow and green) playing pieces, plus game instructions.

Aristo - The Game

The AIM - to try to end the game with a majority of your color pieces on the board. Aristo is a game of wits. You have to outwit your opponent, overturn as many of his pieces as possible in each turn and aim to cover the playing board with your color.
Sounds simple? The problem is that your opponent is trying to do exactly the same to you!!! Are your pieces blocked? Are most of the pieces on the board your opponent's color? Don't give up... one well placed piece can turn your opponent's pieces over to your color in up to eight different directions at once!!!

Name: DEMOCRACity
Description: Democracity is an educational game. By establishing a political party and creating a city, players learn how politics work. As a group they work together at a political project. They experience that debate, majority and consensus are needed in a democratic society and that all votes count.

Name: X is for uneXplained
Description: Answer questions on UFO sightings, Psychic phenomena, Out of body experiences or Alien abduction. Be the first to collect cards from all the different categories and return to Earth to win. A different take on the Trivial Pursuit theme for all those who believe the truth really is out there.

Name: Old MacDonald Soundtracks
Description: The Listen and Match Sing-a-Long game for children 2 years old and up. Designed to develop the child's listening, concentration and matching skills.

Name: India's Epic Mahabharata Game
Description:
India’s Epic Mahabharata Game is a track game based on the most magnificent epic of Indian mythology. Players gain support from one of the two warring families, either the Pandava or Kaurava. To win, players must obtain 1 Celestial Weapon card, 1 Flag or Conch card, 8 Virtue Cards and 18 Coins.

Players roll 2d6 to move around the board, each square of which is an event. Warrior squares grant the support of individual warriors (such as Arjuna or Karna), or require a Joust (if the warrior square denotes someone who is in the same family as those that support the player) or a Fight (if from the other family). Karma squares confer a card with random events, such as “you grab 2 Coins from each player!” or “Give up 2 coins to receive 2 Virtue Cards.” Prowess squares give cards that confer either Virtue cards (needed to win) or Wrath cards (which cause a Virtue discard) to the various warriors. Many squares are a people (Krishna, Queen Kunti, etc.) or places (Indraprastha, Abode of Yama, etc.) that confer a random event, often a Blessing or Coins. Subtracks allow special 1d6 movement through Exile or Trial where players can obtain the key winning elements of Celestial Weapons and Flags/Conches.

The cards and board both relate some of the many events from the epic. The designer is a noted educator, and this was clearly intended to be an educational game.

Name: Table Badminton
Description:
This is a dexterity game where players try to hit the shuttlecocks into their opponent's territory to score points.

Similar to Tennis Game and Badminton

Name: Original Sudoku Card Game
Description:
Just like Sudoku game, the original one.
But the numbers are presented by playing card forms.
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Holiday Charades!
Description: Charades redone with a holiday theme.  Consists of 60+ cards with the name of a holiday classic: movies, books, songs, and characters.  As in the classic game, upon drawing a card, it is up to the players to act out the Charades for teammates.  Tips and hints included on some cards.

Name: Warlords & Wizards
Description: The most challenging board game created since the ancient game of chess.  Imagine controlling two armies of magical creatures with specific movement patterns into battle.  Enter your most powerful piece, the Wizard, from off the battlefield to create havoc for your opponent.  Use your Dragon Slayer and Priestess in mystical movements to bewilder your challenger.  Confuse your opponent by disguising your true intentions, followed with an ambush from your Warlord; Combine your sorceress, Elf, and Fortress to finish off your rival in one breathtaking conclusion!

Name: GummiHamster 40K
Description:
Appeared in Dork Tower: The Junkfood Issue (#19 June/July 2002).

Miniatures rules for Gummi Bear warfare.

You need:
-- 10 Gummi Bears for each player's army (each player has Gummi Bears of a distinct color)
-- a dollar bill for measuring movement distance and attack zone
--a set of 'Fate Bears' for each player (one bear of each of the five main colors) for combat resolution.
--Play area with obstacles

On your turn, you may move (some or all of your Gummis) and the attack. Combat is resolved by the attacker secretly choosing a Fate Bear and the defender secretly choosing one or more (depending on the situation) Fate Bears. If the attacker's Fate Bear does not match any of the defender's Fate Bear colors, the attack is successful.

Comes with 4 scenarios (variants).

Name: Hokm
Description:
Hokm is an old trick-taking card game from Iran usually played with four players in fixed partnerships; however there are 2 and 3-player variants. It is part of the Whist family of card games and similar to spades, but there is no bidding, and trump is declared every hand.

The object of Hokm is to be the first team or player to win 7 points. It's the most popular card game in Iran. Deal and play are anticlockwise.

The word Hokm literally means "command, order" but in card game jargon, it's Persian for trump suit.

Hâkem
At the beginning of each hand, one of the players becomes Hâkem. Hâkem literally means "ruler, governor" and in card game jargon, it refers to a player having certain privileges in the game. In Hokm, these privileges are:

- To be the player who receives the first cards dealt. 
- To be the player who makes trump (i.e. chooses and declares what suit will be trump) for the current hand. 
- To be the player who leads to the first trick of the hand.

Players and Cards
Hokm can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. If with four players, two players normally team up against the other two.

The game uses a standard 52-card deck. Within each suit, the cards are ranked from highest to lowest: A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2

Name: Math Magic
Description: This unique game encourages children to learn how to add and subtract in a fun way.  The player matches a problem card with an answer card and then turns them over.  If the match-up is correct, a complete animal picture is formed on the other side.

Name: The Welfare Game & A Modest Solution
Description:
A St. Croix's Socio/Economic Game Kit

The sensational game that shows how to stop spiraling welfare costs: stimulate the economy: bring creativity back to the bureaucracy and make money for it's players!

Name: The People's Choice
Description: Four parties (Democrat, Green, Libertarian, and Republican) compete for ten US Senate seats.  The catch:  they don't know until the end game which method (plurality, instant runoff, approval, Borda count, or Condorcet) will be used to count the ballots!  Special cards cover fund raisers, gerrymandering, apathy, scandals, and ballot tampering.

Name: Bible Action Heroes Matching Game
Description: Match the Bible Hero with their Biblical action he or she performed.  Suitable for ages 4 & up.

Name: Take Five: The Phase 10 Board Game
Description:
The gameboard is a 10x10 grid, numbered from 1-12 in four different colors (brown, orange, red, and green). The center four squares are marked "Skip." A deck of PHASE 10 cards and plastic chips in three colors are also provided.

Players play cards that allow them to place a chip on a square that matches the card's color/number combination. Players attempt in this way to place five of their chips in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row. "Skip" cards allow the player to place a chip on one of the matching center squares, and cause the following player to miss the next turn. Wild cards are also included.

Name: Chinchirorin
Description:
Chinchirorin is a traditional Japanese dice game for 2 or more players. Derived from the Chinese game Sz'ng Luk, it is also known by other names, including See-Low, One-Two-Three, and Strung Flowers, just to name a few.

Chinchirorin gained a small degree of renown abroad after its inclusion as a 'mini-game' in several installations of the popular Playstation video game series 'Genso Suikoden' by Konami. The only components required are 3standard six-sided dice and a small bowl in which to roll them.

Players take turns making wagers, then rolling the dice to try to outscore each other.  Very lucky rolls, called 'storms', can even multiply the wagers several fold.  A common analogy compares Chinchirorin to an oriental version of 'craps'.

Name: Robotech CCG
Description:
Hero Factory released this collectible card game in the summer of 2006 based on the popular Robotech television series. The game simulates battles between opposing factions, and features all the characters and mechas from the anime. Though not 'collectible' in a traditional sense (all of the cards are the same rarity, sold in pre-constructed 'theme' decks), the game is still fully customizable, with over 250 unique cards planned in the full set for deck construction.

There are 5 different decks currently available, each containing 50 cards with a fixed composition (no randomly inserted cards):

Robotech CCG Starter deck
Azonia' Forces Deck
Blue Squadron Deck
Breetai's Forces Deck
The SDF-1 Deck

Hero Factory also plans to release two additional decks, the 'Robotech Masters 2-Player Starter' and the 'New Generation 2-Player Starter', early in 2007, but further details beyond that point have not been disclosed.

Name: Het Elfstedenspel
Description:
This is a game about the Elfstedentocht (Eleven Cities Tour), a 200-km ice skating race that leads through eleven different cities.

Each player tries to win the race by being the first to reach the finish. Every turn, a player rolls a die and moves his pawn (a skater) as many spaces forward as the die indicates.

Depending on the field where he ends, several follow-up actions are possible, such as having to move back some spaces (due to adverse wind) or taking another turn (because the public cheers you on). On certain fields, the player must answer a trivia question on the Elfstedentocht. The questions are about the race itself and about the eleven cities.

Name: Word$tock
Description:
From the box:

Word$tock -- the unique definitional word game of skill, strategy, and chance --- is designed to increase vocabulary, build word power, and enhance verbal expressive ability in children and adults by utilizing selected word categories and graduated vocabulary levels.

Game Format: Four thousand words at five graduated levels of difficulty, from eight interesting word categories are required to be defined according to one of five versions or variations of Word$tock: Family, Cut-Throat, Cooperative, Solitaire, and Boardless.

Game Objectives: (1) To define correctly words of varying difficulty in specified word categories; (2) to increase knowledge of words and their usage; (3) to stimulate interest in language and learning in general; and (4) to experience FUN in a learning situation.

Name: Quinna
Description:
Quinna was developed by NBV (Nykterhetsrörelsens bildningsverksamhet/ The Educational activity of the Sobriety movement) to be part in a study circle about womens situation across the world.

You and those you play each with choose a women and then roll dice to either answer questions about Womens Rights and situations or about the situation for the women you choice to play. When you answer correctly you get a tile to a puzzle that will end up showing the womens face. First one to get the full face wins. You might also both lose and get bonus tiles when you use the dice.

Name: City Dogs
Description: A children's game where you move around the board trying to collect four cards.  Looks to be a fairly simple game suitable for younger children.

Name: Quest for Clients
Description: Quest for Clients is developed and produced by Identity Games for Capgemini. It is a Monopoly-like game, where each 'street' is a client, and the players are competing consultants, who try to win the game by offering more service to clients, and trying to keep other consultants away from clients.

Name: Sammakot satimessa
Description: Sammakot satimessa is Finnish for something like "Frogs in the Trap." The idea of this game is to get four frogs that share a trait on the same line (orthogonally or diagonally) to score a point. It's a bit like Tic-tac-toe on a 4x4-grid. There's a possibility for double points if your frogs share two traits. It's also possible that more than one winning line is formed at same time. 5 points to win game.

Name: Scoop 'em Up
Description: Players compete to assemble ice cream cones from hands of colorful scoop-shaped cards, each depicting one of five ice cream flavors.  Includes rules for four different game variants (two resemble war, two are rummy-like).

Name: Marines versus Zombies
Description:
From the item's listing:           
 "Trapped in a crumbling city, surrounded by brain eating zombies... Can the gallant marines make it to the helipad for evac before they become lunch?" Marines versus Zombies is an exciting game for two or more players. A group of marines has been cut off from base and must struggle to find the helipad and escape. The map is constructed from 25 face-down tiles, randomly laid out in a 5x5 grid which allows for a unique game every time.

Marines vs. Zombies is a 46 page book with everything you need to run complete games.

Name: Kang Le Qi
Description:
This is a traditional Chinese variant of Snakes and Ladders. Like Snakes and Ladders, it takes place on a square board with a boustrouphedron track, and players roll a die to move their piece from start to finish. The distinguishing features of this distinct subgenre are that the board is set in a playground with many children playing on a see-saw, a slide, a Ferris wheel, a merry-go-round, and so on. Some squares will have instructions that will move the player forward, backward or cause a missed turn.

Like other traditional Chinese games of this ilk, it is made by different companies and comes in small boxes with a folded paper board - in this case, the board is often fairly colourful. More modern versions include cartoon character themes (e.g. Doraemon Kang Le Qi, Snoopy Kang Le Qi).

Name: 18SX
Description: 18SX is an 18xx game and is a reworking of 1837 SX by the same author.  It is available German as well as in English either as kit or as RTP. The game has 13 corporations, up to 10 of which may be in play, with 'concessions' to determine who may start which companies distributed in a start-packet system. The game has a unique track system where directors have to choose between single and double track which will also have an effect on route length.

Name: 18EC: USA East Coast
Description:
18EC is a new 18xx gamekit published by Wolfram Janich in 2005. Available in kit and ready-to-play form, in both English and German, the game is set between the east coast of the USA and the Mississippi. The game has a larger-than-usual bank and a very large map, leading to a long game, even for 18xx titles.

May be purchased directly from the designer in kit form or ready to play.

Name: Monopoly: Bank Elhaz Elsaed
Description: An Egyptian Monopoly version, where the 27 properties are countries; grouped in 2, 3 or 4. The countries: Sudan, Lebanon, Jordan, Syria, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Egypt, Sudan (again), Yemen, UAE, Oman, Libya, Tunisia, Algeria, Morocco, Mauritania, Qatar, France, Italy, England, Germany, USA, Russia / USSR, Japan, Spain, Canada. Money are shares of 1 - 5 - 10 - 20 - 50 - 100 500 - 1000 - 2000. You can build pink hotels, black markets and blue garages.

Name: Prehistoric Dogs
Description: Be the first player to collect 'The Cavepainter's Palette', 'The Cookout Spear', 'Fire Sticks' and 'The Big Round Turning Thing That's Fun to Chase' pieces for each player.

Name: Launch Across
Description: A fast dexterity game. Players sit across from each other. Each has a set of plastic balls (blue or yellow). The board is a Connect Four style grid with an opening at the top, and a backboard. You use a plastic catapult-like flipper to pop your balls into the grid (either simultaneously, or in turns) ... first to get four in a row wins!

Name: Card Dice
Description:
The game comprises a deck of cards that set the challenge and four 14 sided dice that mimic a deck of cards (including jokers).  The start player takes a card and reads the challenge (roll 4 dice and get all hearts and diamonds; get a flush; get two pairs etc), and then all players roll the dice, and will score according to how many rolls it takes for them to achieve the challenge. The game continues like this for 14 rounds (regardless of number of players), highest score at the end is the winner.

Apparently patented worldwide, the only version of this game I have seen is an Arsenal Football Club colored edition.

Name: Dead Man's Dice
Description:
Dead Man's Dice ... avast there ye swabs, 'tis a pirates' fast 'n' fun game o' dice.

Games Above Board publishes the 2 to 6-player game ... with or without a bandana.  T-shirts also available.
Channel Craft publishes a 2-player version with red and black dice.

Pirates take turns rolling (and then stacking) dice to build point-scoring piles o' treasure ... by matching like numbers, numbers in succession or sums of 7.

Plundering the opponent's dice is not only permitted but strongly advised.

Pillaging is not recommended - you have been warned!

Beware the Jolly Roger … double your points and seal victory or, if caught holding Dead Man's Dice, be keelhauled to subtract 7 points.

Sending your opponent to Davy Jones' Locker by firing a broadside is one way to sink your opponent but it will cost you in doubloons.

Played round by round - the first to score a total of 100 doubloons (points) wins.

Name: Macius: Rette die Tiere!
Description: King Macius has collected many exotic animals for his zoo.  Now they are very hungry.  You must help King Macius feed the animals.

Name: Dr. Seuss's ABC
Description: Players move along a track of 52 spaces (A a B b C c . . . Z z), and if the first to land on a square they take and keep a matching card with an image and word or phrase from the book upon which the game is based.  Movement is determined by a spinner; each result can be taken either as a number (1-4), or "BIG" or "little" which advances one to the next upper- or lowercase lettered space.  Game ends when the last player reaches the end, and the winner is the player who holds the most cards.  Recommended for ages 3+.

Name: China: Grenzstreitigkeiten
Description:
This is a free print-and-play map that allows to play a variant of the game China.

The map adds two new features:
• Border towns, which allow a player to place a house into a space that counts as belonging to both adjacent regions.
• Port Towns, which act as an additional region that will be scored at the end of the game with the same house-scoring rules as other regions.

These new features add a bit more complexity, depth, and confrontation while still maintaining the simplicity of the basic game.

Expands:

    China

Name: Monster Dice
Description: Monster Dice is a game that uses extra dice from a player's collection to wage war.  Each player is given a game card showing what type of dice are used in their fantasy army - and the back of other cards are used for the hex battlefields.  The player who manages to keep their army alive the longest is the winner!

Name: Fridgeplay Golf
Description:
One of the more novel designs from FridgePlay, compared to the more traditional games they've adapted to playing on a metal wall surface. It is a light-weight golf game, where the players alternate building the course from a stock of fairway tiles. Actual play involves choosing a long or short stroke, and resolving distance and accuracy with a spinner.

Using hallmark FridgePlay presentation, games can be played over a long period of time by room mates who would rather not see each other but still are trustworthy enough not to cheat.

Name: Bambukarhut
Description: Bamboo bears known from TV are here. Join Bamboo-Lee, Slo-Lee and Dah-Lin for an adventure. If you're lucky you're traveling fast on the back of the dragon Ai-Ai. If you're not so lucky the Rats appear and try to slow you down. Players are traveling around the world and saving endangered species. The game teaches kids ecology and they can learn about endangered species.

Name: Down Styphon!
Description:
Down Styphon! Is a miniatures game simulating Musket and Pike warfare. The setting of the game is based on one of the stories in the Paratime series by H.Beam Piper. The main character Lord Kalvin, who is a Penn. State Trooper that ends up on a parallel earth where the 'secret' of gunpowder is controlled by a group of Priests who's influence and gunpowder or 'Fireseed' as it's called can be bought and controlled. Kalvin also possesses the knowledge of making 'Fireseed', better guns and the history of warfare.
     The rule book is 20 pages with two card stock loose pages that have turn references and combat result tables. This game was designed in 1977 when 25mm was the dominant figure scale (15mm scale had just come into being), but you can easily change the scale for movement and range by dividing the 25mm distances in half or by replacing inches with centimeters. You can use any English Civil war minis for this and the has four pages of line drawings showing how the armies look and what colors to use for each of the different armies. 
     Scale for 28mm is 1 figure = 20 men. You can change this if you like using 15, 6, or even 2mm (for 1:1 fun) change range and movement distance as you scale down. 
     Orders are written down with simultaneous movement.

Name: Valtra Tractors
Description:
A tactical game where each player is trying to build the longest route for his/her tractor.

Re-implements:

Bombay Bazar

Name: Mission Impossible Game
Description: Players start at the four corners of the board and use a spinner to move 1-6 spaces.  Players are also able to use Road Block cards and Mission Impossible cards to achieve their objective.

Name: Mighty Comics Superheroes Game
Description: Includes superheroes from comic books published under the Mighty Comics imprint of MLJ/Archie (who were more successful publishing teenage humor comics featuring  Archie and friends). Many of the featured heroes are members of the Mighty Crusaders team. For some reason several of the names are slightly different from how they appear in the comics. The ten heroes featured are: The Shield, The Web, Mr. Justice, Fly Girl, Fly Man (originally called The Fly), Captain Flagg (spelled with one "G" in the comics), The Hood (The Black Hood), Mr. Fox (The Fox), Mr. Jag (The Jaguar), and Mr. Steel (Steel Sterling).  First to the middle wins.

Name: Justice League of America: The Flash Game
Description: Board has playing spaces in the shape of letter "F." Board background features The Flash, Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman and The Martian Manhunter. Comes with insert with built-in spinner and game cards.  Spin the spinner and be the first to the finish square.

Name: Tarzan Jungle Map and Treasure Hunt
Description:
Tarzan Jungle Map and Treasure Hunt came free with the purchase of Weston's English Quality Biscuits in 1933. The map measures 20" x 14" and is in full color.  Each player could be Tarzan, Akut, Sheeta, or Numa.  Players draw upside-down tiles numbered 1, 2, 3, or 4 and then move the corresponding number of footprints along the jungle map.  The first person to reach the end of the Tarzan Trail wins the Treasure Hunt.

An Australian version also exists which was produced by John Sands for the Pepsodent Toothpaste company as a free promotional game  in 1933

Name: Pebbles Flintstone Game
Description: For ages 7 to 14.  Text on the box appears "Live wire on the Bedrock exchange."  Comes with spinner, money, and Fred, Wilma, and Pebbles cardboard figures.  Spinner has an inner and outer circle.  Match the results to the switchboard board to discover if the call went through or not.

Name: Nature Enjeux Monde
Description: Learn about vegetation, animals and minerals in our world. No need to be a pro, you can learn as you play with 2,400 questions, miming and drawing.

Name: Challenge Series Strategy Boxing
Description: The game includes two decks, one red, one blue, each consisting of 21 color-coded cards (representing punches thrown and punches you can be hit by), a Scoring Index for each, two Scorer's Aid cards, a Rule Booklet detailing both Basic and Advanced versions of play, a pad of 40 Scorecards, a Point Margin Adjustment Chart for solitaire play and a specially developed Rating System Guide.

Name: Korall
Description: In Korall, players imitate a western ranch by moving their horses through passes, trails and along the fence line in a competition to be the first one to get four of their horses in a corral.

Name: HMO: The Game
Description:
Welcome to HMO: The Game. This is a medical game designed for people affiliated with today's medico-commercial-legal-governmental complex or what was once called health care. Americans have always been able to laugh at adversity. Hopefully this game will help you see the humor in our changing medical system.

The object of the game is to accumulate $500,000 to retire from practice. There's many obstacles to overcome such as income tax, malpractice premiums, litigation, and much more.

Playing pieces are a syringe, urinal, hot water bottle, and a crutch. Game also includes gameboard, 1 die, play money, deck of 4 different situation cards (Family Affairs, Legal Encounters, Practice of Medicine, and Investment/Taxes), and instructions.

Name: Blackboard
Description:
An educational Black History game. You begin with a chain that has 7 removable links. You roll the dice, move your game piece (Amistad slave ship) around the board, and follow the instructions for each space. When you land on a question space, you must answer the question for that category. Each time you answer a question correctly,  you'll discard one link. If you answer incorrectly, you'll collect a link. The first player to run out of links, wins the game.

The game includes a 20" game board, 7 game pieces (Amistad slave ships), liberation dice (red, black, & green), chains, entertaining situation cards, game rules, and multiple choice question cards (covering Entertainment, Politics, Science, Invention, Art, Literature, Sports, Education, Law, and more). Over 420 questions.

Name: The Mighty Hercules Game
Description: Game based on the 1963 TV series, The Mighty Hercules.  In the series, Hercules got his great strength from a magic ring given to him by his family, the father sky god Zeus. The object of the game is to get your Hercules character up to Mount Olympus.

Name: The Gazette Board Game
Description:
The Gazette Board Game was apparently created as a promotional piece for Russell Viers' DIGIVersity.tv, which provides workshops, seminars, and in-house training on page layout and graphic design software for newspapers, print and publishing companies.

As a promotional piece for a graphic design company, it's top-notch. As a board game, it's at about the level of "The Game of Life."

Players take on the role of newspaper publishers with the object to be the first publisher to get the paper out without going broke. Players start with $3360, roll the dice, and move their rocket-shaped pawns from the start toward the finish. Along the way, spaces instruct the players to either move ahead a number of spaces, move backward, or collect or pay money.

The instructions on spaces are laced with humor. Some examples: "Your favorite typeface is Helvetica. Back 1 space." "Your intern just cut off a finger with an X-acto knife. Back 2 spaces." "Your customer faxed you their camera-ready ad. Back 3 spaces." "Finally sold your old CompuGraphic. Collect $10." Those with any familiarity with the newspaper business will find these bits amusing. All others will be scratching their heads.

Name: Up N' Over
Description:
The striking lime green plastic circular gameboard is about 15" in diameter.  It is divided into twelve equal segments, each with a hole near the circumference.  A small ball on a string is attached to the center of the board.  The board has been designed with incomplete joins between each of the twelve sectors so that it is possible to flip the ball upwards by pressing down on the edge of any particular segment.

Players select an equal area of the board to patrol.  If the ball is flipped into an opponent's hole, the player who achieved this is awarded a point.  Each segment has three rows of holes for colored scoring pegs; a peg is placed in the top row of each segment at the start of the game.  When a point is scored, any one peg from the relevant player's segments is moved down one row.

The first player to move all their score pegs from the top to the bottom row wins the game.

Name: Karma Chakra
Description:
Karma Chakra is a board game that is based on Buddhism.

The game is titled Karma Chakra as it tries to show the outcome of one’s actions from past and present lives leading towards future rebirth. The design concept of the board is based on Mandala, five elements and the Wheel of Life.

Name: Raging Fury: The Hurricane Game
Description: The object of the game is to  keep your properties insured and direct the storm(s) at your opponents property.  The last player in the game is the winner.

Name: Dudeln
Description:
A spin on the lexicon-game: The game has cards with a word on it as well as three possible meanings (one is real). The player in charge reads the word, the meanings and makes up one more meaning. The other players are guessing the right meaning. If they guess right, they get a point. If not, then not. If they guess the made-up the reader get one point.

Came in the short-lived "Travel Fun-Boxes"-Series

Online Play


     BrettspielWelt (real-time)

Name: Copolymer
Description:
Copolymer is an ultra simple Mark Steere game for two players. A printed paper board, a pen of one color, and a pen of another color can be used to play. Any empty, honeycomb-patterned grid with an odd number of cells can be used. Players take turns coloring in at least one cell.  On her turn, a player may fill as many connected cells (adjacent to two of her opponent's cells) as she likes, and ends her turn by filling a cell that is not connected. Once the board is full, the player who has claimed the most cells wins.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

Name: StockPro
Description:
A classic Stock Market Board Game that provides players with the same opportunities and risks. The players no longer need to depend on luck to win the game but rather on their intellectual prowess.  The game includes 3 stocks, each having 6 quarterly earning cards and 3 quarterly dividend cards. 
 The game starts with disclosure of each stock's 3 quarterly earning cards and 1 quarterly dividend cards. Therefore, during the game the players need to sum up the three quarterly earnings and calculate the probabilities of the fourth quarterly earning in order to estimate this year's annual earning, and further the year-end target prices. With comparisons of the current stock prices, the players can conclude if the stock is over-valued or under-valued.  There are also day-to-day return-on-equities and risks due to the fluctuation of each stock. The game provides players the opportunities to play as day-traders or long-run investors, or both. This game teaches players the portfolio management skills and how to make correct strategic investment decisions on the stock market.

Name: Whoa Equivia
Description:
Test your horse sense while horsin 'round with friends or family.

Will it be a photo finish at the wire or could a dark horse come our of no where to win?

With 3,600 questions, three difficulty levels, and six main categories - plus an additional 'challenge' to 
handicap even the most extreme equestrian - the field is left open for players of all ages and horsey knowledge to kick up their heels and have fun.

So grab your lucky horseshoe and give it a try.

Horses   Grooming   Evolution   Sports   Records   Bodyparts   Breeds   Care   Mythology  Rules   Oddities   Tack parts   Species   Disease   History   Associations   Harness   Saddle   Miscellaneous

This and more - you never know what you might learn.

Name: Wildfire
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Dominoes have never been so WILD! Wildfire Domino game is the newest domino game with wilds and features a unique electronic hub which plays “fire” sounds in the background. The hub also calls out what the “wild” numbers are going to be during play. Game includes electronic hub, and unique Wildfire domino set.

Name: Coup de Grâce
Description:
From the publisher's website ( www.rowdygames.com )...

A chopper's got your cannon pinned down and a Special Forces unit is rapidly approaching to take out your HQ. You maneuver your humvee within striking distance of the chopper and deploy an infantry unit to protect your HQ. Then you desperately wait for your tank to appear and tip the balance of power in your favor. A real battle in an on-going war? No, one of 15 realistic combat scenarios found in COUP de GRâCE, a fast-paced, two-player combat board game designed to put your gaming skills to the test, time and again.

COUP de GRâCE is a 2-player combat board game designed to simulate a modern battle between two equal forces. COUP de GRâCE pits commander versus commander, mano-a-mano, and challenges your skills at resource management, troop allocation, attacking, defending and thinking on the fly. Each player manages a force of 16 units which includes one mobile HQ, two Tank Units, two Humvee Units, two Cannon Units, two Infantry Units, two Helicopter Units and five Special Forces Units. Fifteen unique scenarios have been crafted to put your combat management skills to the ultimate test. Players can even come up with their own scenarios and submit them to Rowdy Games.

Each Game Includes:
• 15 Combat Scenarios
• 32 Combat Pieces
• 1 Combat Board
• 1 Combat Guide

Name: Havoc Expansion: The Character Cards
Description:
This expansion for Havoc: the Hundred Years War consists of a collection of promos given out a various conventions brought together into one package. It is not playable without the base game.  It features a new type of character card which is shuffled into the regular card deck and changes the game in interesting ways when one of them is drawn.

For example, the John of Gaunt card, when drawn, joins the game temporarily as a player, cries HAVOC! and starts a battle called The Chevauchées (a group of plundering raids.)
 For those who have asked us, this expansion includes the premium cards that were given out at the game's release in Essen Germany in 2005, and at the first BoardameGeek Conference in Dallas, Texas.

In addition to these, a new card not seen before has been added, as well as two extra Dogs of War which can be added to the game or used as blanks for players that want to try out character ideas of their own.

Expands

    Havoc: the Hundred Years War

Name: Space Goblins
Description:
"Space Goblins" is a unique wargame of Man-to-Goblin combat aboard Spaceships. The premise behind the game is that goblins are real, humans drove them away from Earth a long time ago, and now that humans are space-faring, they discover that the goblins have the same technology and are out for revenge!

The game map depicts a human Federation Star Explorer spaceship which has been rammed and boarded by a goblin War Cruiser, part of which is also depicted on the mapsheet. The ships are divided into corridors and compartments. The counters represent individual combatants. There is no grid, movement is simply conducted room to room. The rules incorporate miniatures-style concepts for units to obstruct movement and line-of-sight. Given the bloodthirsty nature of goblins on the edge of going berzerk, the two forces fight until one side is eliminated.

While the game system is fairly straightforward, there are a number of interesting elements (for example, there is no stacking of counters -- instead, the rules allow for as many counters as can fit into a room on the map without overlapping). There are also a number of special unit types, such as Witch Doctors for the goblins (who can bring the dead back to life), Robots for the humans, and Technicians for both sides. The latter have various skills, including creating and removing barriers, unjamming weapons, etc.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Arubas Schatz
Description:
A mysterious treasure of the Aruba Pirates is on the sea-bottom and may be claimed. Since a player cannot do this alone, friends must be called, i.e. collect four maps (cards) of the player's own sea inhabitant friend in four different colors. Whoever succeeds first wins.

Each player plays one of their four cards (maps) from their hand to the center of the table and compares it with the four maps which are already laid out on the table. The player may either take all maps matching the value of the player's map exactly or take all maps which add up to the number on the player's map. Maps which match the player's designated friend (sea inhabitant) and are of a missing color are added to the others displayed in front of him/her. The others are placed in the player's own discard pile. After all players have played their hand of four map cards, a new round begins. Maps in the center of the table remain.

A few specially designed cards bring additional excitement to the game. For example, with the help of these cards one can snatch away maps of the other players laid out in front of them or take all maps which are laid out in the table center. One may replace the maps that were taken by equivalent maps from their own discard pile. Therefore it is recommended that the player collect some of their own friend maps of the color he/she has already laid out. It is important for the other players to note which colors are in each discard pile as well.

In a variant the progressing values of collected friend maps play a larger role.

Arubas Treasure game did very well with our younger play testers (ages six to ten years). Luck, easy arithmetic, and some memory are part of game play. The maps are beautifully illustrated and of good quality. Thus all in all a really beautiful game for families, more fun with 3 or 4 treasure seekers.

Beate and Hans Schmidt
(Translation done in Google, with a little help from Mary Prasad - some parts skipped due to being incomprehensible.)

Name: Pepe Postflieger
Description:
Players take turn rolling the dice and trying to acquire cubes of the color shown by the dice.  The cubes are hidden from view in bins called airports and players must remember where the cubes are hidden to fulfill their order. If a cube is rolled with the color purple showing it means bad weather and the player cannot fly that round. (miss a turn).
If the player chooses an airport without one of the colors rolled their turn ends. If the airport has the color they need it is loaded into the biplanes wings and the plane flies for home.  Before a plane lands it is flipped over and any cubes that fall out are lost.  All other cubes are worth one coin when delivered to the airport.

The first player to collect 7 coins wins.
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Het Grote Wereldreisspel
Description: A small question and answer game where people move around different continents on a board while answering questions about them. There is a nice twist however, if you answer a question correctly in a category you already have completed yourself you can take away a marker from another player.

Name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in Silver Screen City
Description:
Murder mystery where each of 10 players take up the role of one of the suspects of the murder. This version is set in 1950's in Silver Screen City (Hollywood) and you have to find out who killed Samuel O'Snuffit.

Who killed Samuel O'Snuffit?

Silver Screen City in the 1950s is the venue for a glittering party being hosted by the movie mogul Samuel O'Snuffit. But the evening went off with more of a bang than expected when O'Snuffit was shot dead during the firework display. Why did someone at the party want him dead? What had they to gain? Find out the answers by hosting your own party to solve the mystery of the Murder in Silver Screen City.

The suspects are:
CECIL LETHARIO - film director (his love life has a cast of thousands!)
MALICA FORETHOUGHT - film critic (nobody dare ask what she's thinking!)
LOSTA MORALS - actress (fluent in five languages but never mastered how to say NO in any!)
FANNY CHEZ-LONGE - actress (she likes to audition lying down!)
MONICA MAKEOVER - beauty salon owner (she's always willing to oblige!)
CLARK CRUMPET - actor (he enjoys his tea after his crumpet!)
ONNIS UPPERS - actor (he's definitely seen better days!)
JOHNNY COME-LATELY - actor (the new kid on the block - better late than never!)
SUE SPENDER - singer, dancer & nightclub owner (she likes to keep her men in suspense!)
THE DONNE COSI-NOSTRA - hotel & casino owner (show this Godfather some respect or it could be good night goodfellas!)

Contents:
Guest Invitations 
Guest Nametags
Complete Instructions and Hosting Guide
Character Profiles
Clue Sheets
Costume Suggestions 
Menu Suggestions
Cassette Recording
Murder Solution

Name: UNO: Stars of the American League
Description:
This baseball themed edition of UNO features pictures of American League stars on the cards.  The National League version is the same, but with National League stars.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Top 2" -- this one requires the two players with the fewest number of cards in hand when it is played to draw a card into their hands, with the player playing the "Top 2" card exempt.

Name: Girl Talk Date Line
Description:
Be the first player to match all your Teen cards with dates, then find a date for yourself. The first player to get rid of all their Teencards by making dates wins the game.

Includes talking speaker unit, 30 minute cassette date tape filled with teen conversations, gameboard, 26 plastic teen cards, card holder, 4 game tokens, die, and instructions

Name: Container
Description: Each player receives a truck and a barge and can pick their personal port of call from these four cities: London, New York City, Hamburg, or Rotterdam. Barges await at the docks; trucks start in the middle on individual tracks. Dice are rolled moving trucks along track to warehouse, where they will unload their cargo onto the waiting barges. In-between, however, are points of difficulty: Pilot Station, where one must be certain his Captain is aboard the ship by rolling the green faces on the dice; Point of Application, where one must be certain all papers and formalities are in order by rolling until the green faces on the dice appear; and the Rail Road Overpass, where, again, the green must be rolled before continuing on to the waiting barge. The first player to unload three containers may call himself and his port the best and fastest in the world.

Name: Knowbody Knows
Description:
From the publisher's website...

Do YOU Know?

How many times did you laugh out loud last year? 
How many hours a month does your dad spend "on the can"? 
On a scale between 1 and 1000, how "flirtatious" is your sister? 
How much did your best friend spend on alcohol last year?

There are NO right answers!  The idea is to be the one who didn't guess too high or too low, in comparison to the group playing.

Knowbody Knows - The revealing game of wild guesses.

Name: Star Power
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Star Power is designed for children between the age ranges of 4 to 9. This game is similar in concept and design to Follow the Clues... A Game of Destiny but it simplifies the process and allows the younger child to become acquainted with positive words and thoughts through fun and entertaining action and interplay. This game introduces the child to the 24 angel-like characters, Lit'l Messengers, and in a playful way, teaches the child about the qualities of each angel and their messages. "Star Power" also encourages the child to feel free to act out and participate in exploring "noble sense," values in a fun and joyful way.

Contents:  Game board with 4 plastic baskets, Spinner with plastic arrow, 4 pawns and plastic stands and 25 cards:(24 angel cards and 1 sun card), 4 washable markers, A bag of plastic stars.

Name: Funetically Correct
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Funetically Correct the board game that lets you spell it like you hear it.  Funetically Correct is a game of innocent creativity and flexibility. The game challenges its participants to spell words the way they sound. Players use letters, numbers and a few assorted icons to spell words or phrases.

The game can be played by as few as 2 people or as many as multiple teams. Because the game relies on others being able to identify your word or phrase, the game changes every time you play. Enjoy the experience. Challenge your imagination with this fun, creative game. Recommended for ages 7 and up.

Name: Pete's Lucky Unders
Description:
From the publisher's website...

Easy to learn, quick to play, and fun for the whole family!

Be the first player to get rid of all the cards in yer hand, yer Over-All's and yer Lucky (or not so Lucky) Unders.

Discard cards of equal or higher value than the last card played or play a "Lucky" card that saves you from addin' the whole darn pile to yer hand if you can't beat it.

Includes a deck of 110 cards and instructions.

You won't want to leave this game hangin' out on the line!

Name: Vertic
Description:
From the designer's website...

Vertic is the first creation of our vertical game board system. Yes, it is a board game—it just goes vertical. The object of the game is to get four “Ver” tile cards in a row or four “Tic” tile cards in a row. This might sound easy but each player has the opportunity to drop tile cards, spin the board, or spin segments of the board, which drops tile cards to new locations. This changes tile card and board positioning. Vertic is a game of strategy, memory, movement, and pure excitement. If you want more intensity, add another Vertic Vertical Game Board on top and play eight in a row or add another — just make sure your mind can handle it.

Name: Questionary
Description:
From the publisher's website...

The basic concept is very simple.  You pick a card that has a word on it.  Your team has to guess the word within 90 seconds by asking you any question and as many questions as they like.  But the catch is, you can only answer in 'Yes' and 'No'. A few more answers like ‘May be’ or ‘I don’t know’ are allowed for obvious reasons. If your team cracks the word, it wins and rolls a dice to move its pawn on the scoreboard.  There are bonus points for difficult words! Words have been very carefully selected to have fun & challenge together.

Name: Capt'n Pike's Cruising North America
Description:
From the publisher's website...

Capt'n Pike's Cruising North America is a fun and interesting board game with a nautical theme. Shiver me timbers, it's a totally new concept and there is nothing like it on the seven seas or in the market place. Do you know how many light houses surround Lake Michigan, where is Angel's Gate, how many teeth a shark has, what are your chances of surviving a lighting strike, what is a hawse pipe, where is the Norwegian Riviera, what is a drink water sailor, or who started Chris Craft boats? Find out the answers to theses and over 1000 more while playing Capt'n Pike's Cruising North America.

Choose your vessel and cruise the West Coast, Gulf Coast, East Coast, Mississippi River system and the Great Lakes while answering nautical questions about weather, navigation, boat handling, marlin spike, seamanship, local points of interest and history. Great fun for all who have owned a boat and dreamed of cruising!

Name: Go For Launch!
Description:
From the publisher's website...

It doesn't take a rocket scientist to play Go for Launch!, but if your not careful you could become one! 
The Go For Launch! board game shows you how to prepare a Space Shuttle for launch as you journey through: Deep Space, Early Rocketry, Mercury, Gemini, Apollo, Apollo-Soyuz, Sky-Lab, Astronomy, Planetary Exploration, Space Shuttle, Mir Space Station, Space Spin-Offs and more!

This game is fun for the whole family and great for classrooms. The Go For Launch! board game depicts Complex 39 of the Kennedy Space Center as it exists today. It is designed for one to four players or teams of players.

The players can be assigned as Shuttle Commanders, Pilots and Mission Specialists. Each player obtains their mission instructions from the Commander/Pilot check list. The board game consists of nearly 500 full color photo question and answer cards (T or F and Multiple Choice), four plastic Shuttle game pieces, a pair of dice, instructions and category divider cards.

The game takes the players from the landing strip through Space Shuttle Processing, Launch, Low Earth Orbit and back to Kennedy Space Center. The first Commander to successfully return to the primary landing site wins!

Name: Don't Drink and Drive
Description:
From the designer's website...

So you've been out drinking all night, now it's time to go home. The object of the game is to make it home safe (call a cab). You must drive your car all around the board to the end where home is. On your journey you will encounter some real wacky stuff, laughing your ass off the whole time. You might stop off at another bar or stop for some fast food. You might be able to call a cab to drive you home (that's the plan). You better hope you get a chance to call a cab because there are police cars all over the board waiting to pull over DRUNK DRIVERS.

If your car lands on one of these spaces you must take a sobriety test (30 different tests, tongue twisters, memory tests, physical challenges, etc...), if you fail, you get a DWI and will find yourself in JAIL.

There are over 100 spaces on the board (exploding with exceptional artwork and design) telling you to do all sorts of crazy things. The game can be different every time you play it. You can rear-end people, cut each other off the road and even get into an accident, 3 accidents and/or 3 DWI's and your out of the game. You can also take a different route the next time you play, there are forks in the roads so you can go two different ways, the long route or the short route, which way will you be going? Who knows what's going to happen to you on your way home.

So call a cab and stay out of jail. The players in the cabs usually make it home before anyone, thus being the winner.

Name: ImagiNotions
Description:
From the publisher's website...

Get ready to tickle your brain and stretch the imagination beyond your wildest dreams! ImagiNotions is the fun-filled, thought-provoking, mind-numbing game that literally lets you say what you see!

ImagiNotions are literal word and picture puzzles that form common phrases, people, places, or even other words.

To play, get your team to correctly solve 3 ImagiNotions puzzle cards before time runs out. After the ImagiNotions are solved, strain your brain and tie all three puzzles together to solve the Notion, or theme, of the card! "Advance along the game board for every ImagiNotion and Notion solved correctly. But watch out, and plan your time wisely, because your opponents can steal the puzzles you can't answer!" You'll soon discover the thrill, the fun, and the challenge of this mind-bending, thrill-a-minute game.

So say what you see and relate all three!

That's ImagiNotions!

Game Contents:
900 ImagiNotions Puzzles
150 colorful cards
Custom Card Holder
Deluxe Game Board
2 Tokens
Sand Timer
Easy-to-follow Instructions

Name: Fossil Island
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Take a trip through Fossil Island for an exciting adventure of ups and downs. Players navigate a colorful dinosaur down an eggshell trail by rolling a die & solving an addition card problem.

As you race across Fossil Island, you get to discover shortcuts, take chances on Dino Dare cards, survive the ups and downs, bump an opponent, and race ahead………..try not to fall back!

It’s hours of fun for ages 7 and up. 
Variations for many ages & abilities included. 
People of different ages and abilities will be able to play side by side without the fear of being wiped out. With all on an even playing ground and each making their best contributions, players are all together to the end of the game!

It's completely unique to other board games - or even educational games, offering future potential for creating dozens of games from this one box. Change the game simply by adding a new deck of cards.

This game contains:

45 fossil addition fact cards
Folding game board
72 Dino-Dare cards
12 cross safely cards
4 dinosaur playing pieces
1 multicolored die

Name: Follow the Clues... A Game of Destiny
Description:
From the publisher's website...

Follow the Clues...A Game of Destiny 
 The angels in this game and throughout life are always giving us powerful messages to help, assist and guide us as we continue on our pathway but we are the ones who must follow the clues so that we will reach the sunlight which represents inner joy and happiness in life. The lessons learned, as children will carry us through life.

The game board "Follow the Clues...A Game of Destiny" is done in circles. There is no beginning and no end. For each of us to reach our highest level we must go to the next dimension.

We continue on our journey till we reach complete joy, inner peace and harmony. There are no winners or losers in the game. When the first player reaches his/her goal, he/she is obligated to go back and help another player on the board with support and encouragement to reach his or her goal.

The game may be played by 2-6 players.

Recommended for children age 10 and up

CONTENTS

Game board, spinner with plastic arrow, 6 child like figures with plastic stands, 27 Angel cards with text on the back, one sunlight card, glossary of word and phrase definitions, a pink and blue washable magic marker.

Name: Pass the Bag
Description:
Pass the Bag is an educational game for three to eight players designed to teach colors, shapes and sizes. Components include a plastic bag with one see-through side, four collecting cards and 40 wooden pieces in five shapes, each in two sizes, with four pieces of each size in red, yellow, blue and green.

With up to four players, each player takes a card. Players take turns holding the bag with the clear side facing away (so the other players can see the pieces inside). The current player selects a piece by touch that matches a piece of the right size and shape on his card. If it is the right color, he places it on his card. The first to fill his card wins.

A variant for any number of players is to place up to three cards in the center of the table. Players try to select by touch a piece that matches any piece on any card. A player who draws one of the right color places it on a card. Otherwise, he keeps the piece. When the bag is empty, the player with the fewest pieces in front of him wins.

Players are encouraged to use words, noises, gestures and expressions to mislead the active player into thinking he is touching the correct (or incorrect) color.

Name: Roy Rogers Rodeo Game
Description: Four games include: Bronco Busting/Trick Riding/Bulldogging/Calf Roping. Complete with instructions inside lid.  Comes with board and four rodeo rider figures.  You can be Roy Rogers, Slim Jim, Smokey Joe, or Rusty Mac.

Name: Hopalong Cassidy / Stroehmann's Sunbeam Bread Game
Description: Hoppy and Topper at lower right by spinner. Bottom text reads "Boys And Girls! Tell Mom To Buy Stroehmann's Sunbeam-It's Hoppy's Favorite Bread!"  Spin the spinner and the first to make it to Hoppy's Ranch wins.

Name: Creepy Creatures: Make-a-Snake
Description: Players build onto a snake's head by playing cards in a chain, matching food icons in the snake's body.  Game ends when a player can play a matching tail.

Name: J. Fred Muggs 'Round The World' Game
Description: Based on the popular chimpanzee from the Dave Garroway show of the time, this is a travel game with a Pan American Airways (PanAm) tie-in as well, for 2 to 4 players, ages 7 to 12.   Comes with rules, board, score pad, 4 colored markers, PAA tickets, Pan American coasters, baggage stickers, PanAm calendars and postcards, die.  The coasters, etc., are items that you are supposed to "pick up" along the way.

Name: Rocket's Red Glare
Description:
Subtitled 'A Guide to the War of 1812' this booklet covers the 3 year war between Britain and the infant United States.

The booklet contains historical background, tactics, uniforms, flags, and three sets of miniatures rules. In addition it has 10 land scenarios and 12 naval ones.

One set of miniatures rules is called Battle Scale (1 figure = 50 men), and the other Small Unit Scale (1 figure = 15 men). The third set of rules covers naval actions.

Leaders are handled extremely well in this game. Each leader is rated as one of Brilliant, Efficient, Plodding or Buffoon(!). Ordinary playing cards are used to determine a number of actions each leader may initiate. Cards used include Aces (one action), 2s and 3s (2 and 3 actions, of course) and Jokers (2 actions and reshuffle). A Buffoon's deck has only one "3" card in it, but four aces, while a Brilliant Leader's is the opposite. Thus a small, well-led force can run rings around a much larger, poorly-led one. In the land battles actions affect firing, movement and formation changes; in the naval game they affect firing only.

Quick and fun, as well as being adaptable to other, similar periods.
Families: Series: Canadian Wargamers Group Miniatures Rules

Name: Igelkottens hämnd!
Description: The Hedgehogs Revolt! Players have four cars and four hedgehogs, and one secret goal for each car. The objective of the game is to get all of your cars to their goals while using your hedgehogs to obstruct the other players' cars. When a hedgehog and a car ends up on the same space a card is drawn. The card asks for a certain type of insurance card. If the player can't provide said card, he has to act out a certain mission. The missions are something like "Imitate your favorite animal", "Walk backwards around the table", "Laugh for one full minute", or "Sing a song from the Eurovision Song Contest".

Name: "Still Safe!" Safety Boardgame
Description: Players move their pieces through the hazardous terrain of the laboratory, advancing by answering questions about general lab safety, lab procedures and apparatus, and trying to avoid unsafe practices that will land them in the first aid station.

Name: Assumption
Description:
From the back of the box:
Assumption allows you and your friends to be the experts on every topic imaginable, in a game where there is never an incorrect answer.
Assumption is a fun and intriguing game in which each player must assume to know-it-all in order to win!  If you can admit to being a know-it-all, have ever been accused of being a know-it-all, or happen to know a know-it-all...  Assumption is definitely a game for you!

Object of the game -
To be the player with the best assumptions as to why things are the way they are... to win!!!  Assumption is the game where the players decide the best answers to outrageous questions seldom contemplated!  Questions like...

Why don't fortune tellers win the lottery?
Why don't nudist camps have age restrictions?
Why do men like old cars and not old women?
Why do they make catheter tubing so large?

Name: Putts & Drives
Description:
DRIVES AND PUTTS 
A great game for Golfers to place in their golf bags for those times when the weather pushes them off the course and into the clubhouse.

The deck consists of 48 cards.
With each card having a “shot value” from 0 to 4
The deck consists of the following:

10 - (D) Cards or “DRIVES”
12 - (P) Cards or “PUTTS”
13 - (FW) Cards or “FAIRWAY SHOTS”
2 – “R” Cards or “ROUGH”
2 – (PTY) Cards or “PENALTY STROKE” 
2 - (WC) Wild Cards, may be used as Drive, Fairway or Putt
3 - (ST) Cards or “ SAND TRAPS”
4 - (PS0) Cards or “ PRACTICE SWING”  - Does not count against total strokes on hole, but does count as one of your cards played.

2-4 players
Fast & easy to play
Play 1 hole or 18
Competitive and fun for all ages
Pick your pars, make your birdies & accept your bogeys, low score wins.

Before starting play the dealer or the golf course scorecard decides if the hole is a par 3, par 4, or a par 5.  Cards are then shuffled.

On Par 3's 4 cards are dealt to each player
On Par 4's 5 cards are dealt to each player
On Par 5's 6 cards are dealt to each player
Remaining deck is then placed in the middle of the table and becomes the "FUTURE SWINGS" deck.

PLAY

All players look at their cards and discard one of their cards face up next to the remaining cards this is the discard pile.

The players then draw one card and from the "future swings stack", and then waits for all players to collect one card from the "future swings stack".  Play then continues as each player then discards one card of their choice from their hand.

This cycle of Drawing "Future swings" and discards goes on for two turns.

Following the second round of "future swings" the dealer then takes the stack of future swings and deals each player 2 cards face  down.  After all players have received their face down future swings each is allowed to look at his/her two cards and discard any two cards in their hand.

After all discards the players turn over the cards in their hand & the lowest score wins that hole.  The following are the MINIMUM Requirements for a hand to be played.

On Par 3’s a player is required to hold and play 3 cards.
The minimum requirement to play is one “DRIVE Card (D)” and one “PUTT Card (P).

On Par 4’s a player is required to hold and play 4 cards.
The minimum requirement to play is one “DRIVE Card (D)”, one “FAIRWAY Card (FW),  and one “PUTT Card (P).

On Par 5’s a player is required to hold and play 5 cards.
The minimum requirement to play is one “DRIVE Card (D)”, one “FAIRWAY Card (FW),  and one “PUTT Card (P).

Name: Ausgebüxt
Description:
A game for 2-4 children aged 4 and up in which children use their memory and sense of touch to identify wooden animal shapes hidden in differently colored cloth bags and collect them in their zoo house.

Contents:

4 cardboard zoo houses
24 wooden zoo animals
1 wooden dice with three colors
3 differently colored sacks

Also known as 'Ausgebuxt' in German.

Name: Pinguin-Parade
Description:
A children's game for ages 3 and up in which the winner is the first player to bring all three of their penguins from the feeding grounds back to the nest.

The wooden board pieces are laid out in a trail leading from the feeding grounds to the penguin nest inland.

Players roll the die and move any one of their penguins based on the die results.  Obstacles add difficulty, and whether or not a penguin moves depends on whether it is standing or lying down.

Game components:

12 wooden penguins in 4 colors
4 wooden obstacles (blue discs)
1 large wooden die with movement symbols
8 laminated wooden board pieces

Name: Schnecken-Schmaus
Description:
Schnecken-Schmaus, also known as Snail Banquet in English, is a game for children aged 5 or older in which four small snails are competing to eat strawberries.

Players are secretly assigned a snail to race and take turns hiding a mixture of wooden cubes in each hand.  Based on the guesses of the other players as to how many cubes are hidden in each hand the snails advance along the strawberry trail.  The first player to collect three strawberries by winning races wins.

Components:

4 wooden snails
12 cardboard strawberry pieces
7 red cubes
4 illustrated snail cards

Name: Barbary Coast War (Second Edition)
Description:
From the Guild of Blades "Empires of History" series of Axis and Allies style historical games. Based very loosely on America's war with the Barbary pirates. This new edition features a color box and color components. In addition, boarding combat and ports are now represented by separate mapsheets.

From the back of the box: "Take a side in the first war against terror fought by the young United States against the Barbary Coast Nations. Historically the War lasted from 1801 till about 1806. The War started when the Barbary Nations would board vessels that flew the US flag and take those US citizens as slaves. The U.S. DID at first pay tribute to the King of Tripoli which did make the US a vassal State of the Ottoman Empire (technically speaking). How and if the United States wins is up to you."

Components: small rectangular box, 3 paper game maps, 3 sheets of rules, cut-em-yourself counters, cardboard sheets for mounting counters, ten-sided die.
Families: Series: Compact Game Series (Guild of Blades)
